column4: hi, ubuntu downloaded an upgrade last night and i see ive lost sound... what do i do to fix that ??
hi, ubuntu downloaded an update last night and i see ive lost sound... what do i do to fix that ??
nobody here can fix sound problem ?
dell 1420 by chance?  got the laptop model?
do you get sound in any app?  totem? flash? vlc? audacious? amarok?
none ..
pulse audio running?
how do i check if pulse audio is running ?
open gnome-system-monitor
system -> admin -> system monitor
it says pulse audio sleeping
well that's ok.  sure all your volumes are up?  try changing the output in system->admin->sound?
.. just got sound back .. strange .. but im glad its back
sweet :)
i have an idea
i think its because i installed that app u told me
there's a bug in flash 9 where if you play a flash video, you can't get rhythmbox going again till you close your browser
you could upgrade to flash 10 beta that came out in the last day or two :)
how do i upgrade that ?? ive put all auto updates to update automatically .
use apache :)
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/ApacheMySQLPHP
if you have apache, just put files in /var/www and then browse to http://localhost
